other_tests.findings: Approximately 10 ml of purulent fluid was aspirated; a drain was placed.
other_tests.changes_over_time: During the next 6 days, yellow serosanguineous fluid was recovered from the drain. The abdominal mass was no longer palpable on the seventh day.

other_tests.procedure_name: Biopsy and resection of the mass
other_tests.findings: Mass involved the appendix and mesentery of the distal sigmoid colon, with central necrosis but no residual abscess.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The mass grew from 6 cm to approximately 10 cm in greatest dimension within a week.

other_tests.findings: No malignant cells were found in the cerebrospinal fluid.
